sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The Draw.FillMapleLeaf procedure is used to draw a filled maple leaf on the screen bounded by a rectangle with bottom left and top right corners of (x1, y1) to (x2, y2) and filled using the specified Color. To get a maple leaf outlined in a different color, use Draw.FillMapleLeaf with the Color parameter set to the fill color and then call Draw.MapleLeaf with the Color parameter set to the border color. If y1 is greater than y2, then the mapleleaf is drawn upside down.
sections.mdown_content: The **Draw.FillMapleLeaf **procedure is used to draw a filled maple leaf on the screen bounded by a rectangle with bottom left and top right corners of (*x1*, *y1*) to (*x2*, *y2*) and filled using the specified *Color*. To get a maple leaf outlined in a different color, use **Draw.FillMapleLeaf** with the *Color* parameter set to the fill color and then call **Draw.MapleLeaf**  with the *Color* parameter set to the border color. If *y1* is greater than *y2*, then the mapleleaf is drawn upside down.

sections.title: Example
code:
View.Set ("graphics")
        Draw.FillMapleLeaf (0, 0, 100, 100, brightred)
        Draw.MapleLeaf (0, 0, 100, 100, black)
        Draw.FillMapleLeaf (150, 100, 250, 0, green)
sections.raw_content: This program will draw two maple leaves beside each other. The first will be outlined in black and filled in brightred. The second maple leaf will be upside down and both filled and outlined in green.
sections.mdown_content: This program will draw two maple leaves beside each other. The first will be outlined in black and filled in brightred. The second maple leaf will be upside down and both filled and outlined in green.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content:
The Draw.FillMapleLeaf procedure is useful for drawing the Canadian flag.

The screen should be in a "graphics" mode. See the View.Set procedure for details. If the screen is not in a "graphics" mode, it will automatically be set to "graphics" mode.
sections.mdown_content:
The **Draw.FillMapleLeaf** procedure is useful for drawing the Canadian flag.
The screen should be in a "*graphics*" mode. See the **View.Set** procedure for details. If the screen is not in a "*graphics*" mode, it will automatically be set to "*graphics*" mode.

sections.title: Status
sections.raw_content:
Exported qualified.

This means that you can only call the function by calling Draw.FillMapleLeaf, not by calling FillMapleLeaf.
sections.mdown_content:
Exported qualified.
This means that you can only call the function by calling **Draw.FillMapleLeaf**, not by calling **FillMapleLeaf**.

sections.title: See also
sections.raw_content: View.Set, maxx, maxy and the various procedures in the Draw unit.
